txt_en: The wisest mind has something yet to learn.
txt_cn: 就连最智慧的人也有东西要学。
author: George Santayana

txt_en: We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.
txt_cn: 我们心中都有光明和黑暗，但更重要的是我们选择哪一面。这才是我们真正的样子。
author: J.K. Rowling

txt_en: Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.
txt_cn: 当一个孩子觉得自己能成功完成一项任务时，千万别去帮他。
author: Maria Montessori

txt_en: I cannot give you the formula for success, but I can give you the formula for failure—which is: try to please everybody.
txt_cn: 我不能给你成功的公式，但我可以给你失败的公式，那就是：试图取悦每个人。
author: Herbert Swope

txt_en: Wish not so much to live long as to live well.
txt_cn: 与其希望活得久，不如祈盼过得好。
author: Benjamin Franklin

txt_en: The expert in anything was once a beginner.
txt_cn: 任何领域的专家也曾是一名初学者。
author: Helen Hayes

txt_en: Be a first rate version of yourself, not a second rate version of someone else.
txt_cn: 做一流的自己，不做二流的别人。
author: Judy Garland

txt_en: You were not made to live like brute beasts, but to pursue virtue and knowledge.
txt_cn: 人不应当像走兽一样活着，而应该追求知识和美德。
author: Dante Alighieri

txt_en: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
txt_cn: 浅薄者相信运气；有能力的人相信因果。
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

txt_en: Things are never as bad as they seem.
txt_cn: 事情永远不会像它看起来那样糟糕。
author: 《杀死一只知更鸟》

txt_en: All that is necessary for the triumph of evil is that good men do nothing.
txt_cn: 欲使恶人得胜，只需好人袖手旁观。
author: Edmund Burke

txt_en: He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he who loses courage loses all.
txt_cn: 失去财产的人损失很大，失去朋友的人损失更多，而失去勇气的人则失去了一切。
author: Cervantes

txt_en: Be patient with yourself. Self-growth is tender; it's holy ground. There's no greater investment.
txt_cn: 要对自己有耐心，自我成长是温柔的过程，是神圣之地，也是最有价值的投资。
author: Stephen Covey

txt_en: Reprove thy friend privately; commend him publicly.
txt_cn: 在私下批评你的朋友，在公开场合赞扬他。
author: Solon

txt_en: No matter how small and unimportant what we are doing may seem, if we do it well, it may soon become the step that will lead us to better things.
txt_cn: 不管我们现在所做的事看起来有多么的微不足道或不重要，如果我们认真地做，它可能很快就会引领我们通向美好事物。
author: Channing Pollock

txt_en: The future has several names. For the weak, it is the impossible. For the fainthearted, it is the unknown. For the thoughtful and valiant, it is the ideal.
txt_cn: 未来有几个名字：对软弱的人来说，它叫不可能；对胆怯懦弱的人来说，它叫未知；对于深思熟虑且有勇气的人来说，它叫理想。
author: Victor Hugo

txt_en: A person can succeed at almost anything for which they have unlimited enthusiasm.
txt_cn: 只要有无限的热情，一个人几乎可以在任何事情上取得成功。
author: Charles M. Schwab

txt_en: You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process, is its own reward.
txt_cn: 你可以做任何你决定的事，你可以采取行动改变或控制你的人生；而这过程，本身就是报偿。
author: Amelia Earhart

txt_en: Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
txt_cn: 为他人带来阳光的人，自己也一定会沐浴在阳光下。
author: James Barrie

txt_en: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
txt_cn: 世界上大多数重要的事情，都是由那些在看似毫无希望时还继续努力的人完成的。
author: Dale Carnegie

txt_en: Many individuals have, like uncut diamonds, shining qualities beneath a rough exterior.
txt_cn: 很多人像未经雕琢的钻石，在粗糙的表面下有发光的本质。
author: Juvenal

txt_en: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.
txt_cn: 在一天结束的时候，别留下任何借口、解释或悔恨。
author: Steve Maraboli

txt_en: The path to your success is not as fixed and inflexible as you think.
txt_cn: 成功之路并非你想的那么死板和不可改变。
author: Misty Copeland

txt_en: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
txt_cn: 并不是因为事情难我们才不敢去做，而是因为我们不敢做事情才难。
author: Seneca

txt_en: There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind.
txt_cn: 比起遗落在过去的，未来还有更加美好的在等着我们。
author: C.S. Lewis

txt_en: Without self-discipline, success is impossible, period.
txt_cn: 无自律，不成功，就这样。
author: Lou Holtz

txt_en: I am seeking, I am striving, I am in it with all my heart.
txt_cn: 我在寻找，我在努力，我全身心地投入其中。
author: Vincent van Gogh
